perturbation.original_text: 2.2.1. You must give us written notice of your desire to exercise your option not more than twelve (12) months and not less than nine (9) months before this Agreement expires.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.2.1. You must give us written notice of your desire to exercise your option not more than three (3) months and not less than one (1) month before this Agreement expires.
perturbation.explanation: This modification reduces the notification window for exercising the franchise renewal option. This could potentially violate state franchise laws, which often require a longer notification period to protect franchisees' interests.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State franchise laws regarding renewal notification periods (e.g., California Franchise Relations Act)

perturbation.original_text: 3.7. Delinquency. If any Royalties or other amounts owed to us are not paid in full by the due date, we have the right to charge interest on the overdue amount at the rate of one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month (or the maximum rate permitted by applicable law, if less than 1.5%) from the date such amount was due until paid in full. Unpaid interest charges will compound annually.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.7. Delinquency. If any Royalties or other amounts owed to us are not paid in full by the due date, we have the right to charge interest on the overdue amount at the rate of five percent (5%) per month from the date such amount was due until paid in full. Unpaid interest charges will compound daily.
perturbation.explanation: This change increases the interest rate on overdue amounts to 5% per month and compounds interest daily. This could be considered usurious and violate state usury laws, which set limits on the maximum interest rates that can be charged.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1. Business Records. You agree to keep complete and accurate books, records, and accounts of all business conducted under this Agreement, in the form and manner prescribed in the Manual or other written instructions. You must preserve all of your books and records in at least electronic form for seven (7) years from the date of preparation.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1. Business Records. You agree to keep complete and accurate books, records, and accounts of all business conducted under this Agreement, in the form and manner prescribed in the Manual or other written instructions. You must preserve all of your books and records in at least electronic form for one (1) year from the date of preparation.
perturbation.explanation: This reduces the record retention period from seven years to one year. This could violate federal and state tax laws and regulations that require businesses to maintain records for a longer period (e.g., for audit purposes).
